resource.name: Use of Force Reports
resource.description:
This dataset includes each force report filed by a CSPD officer. In the vast majority of situations, each officer completes a report for each subject of force. One incident may have multiple force reports.

There is an exception to how force is normally reported for incidents involving crowds where the officer cannot identify subjects. This can happen in a crowd situation because subjects often flee the scene before they can be identified and specifically included in the force report. In these situations, the officer completes one report for multiple subjects of force. If the reason for force in a report is listed as "Crowd-Failure to Disperse" or "Failed to Disperse," it may be a report with multiple subjects. To learn more, see our Use of Force Overview.
columns_description: Gender of the officer who used force
Unique identifier for each officer. This number does not exist in a CSPD system; it is computer generated.
Age of the officer who used force, at the time of incident
Subject's age at time of incident
Reason force was used (only one reason per report allowed)
Date and time force was used
Number assigned by the Computer Aided Dispatch system to each incident (aka, call for service)
Number assigned to each force report by CSPD's force data records system
Officer's assignment
Race/Ethnicity of person who was the subject of force
Number of years officer was employed at CSPD, at the time of incident
Gender of the person who was the subject of force
Year force was used
Whether officer was injured in the force incident, including pain only
Race/ethnicity of the officer who used force
Whether subject was injured in the force incident, including pain only
Unique identifier for each subject of force. This number does not exist in a CSPD system; it is computer generated.

resource.name: Arrest Data with all Offenses and Demographic Detail
resource.description: This dataset includes all arrests with all offenses listed for each arrest.  Each offense lists the demographic information for the person arrested for that offense.  There may be multiple offenses for an arrestee.  This dataset should only be used for counting the number of offenses related to arrests.
columns_description: City in which arrest occurred
Number used to identify a case in CSPD's records management system
Number used to identify an arrest in CSPD's records management system.
National Crime Information Center Offense Code Description
Age of arrestee at time of arrest
Gender of arrestee
Location of arrest
Race of arrestee
CSPD Patrol Division in which arrest occurred
Uniform Crime Reporting Offense Code Description
Age range of arrestee at time of arrest
CSPD records management description of statute or ordinance. City ordinance violations are generally in all caps.
Type of arrest (e.g. warrant, probable cause arrest, serve and release)

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Neighborhoods' (2q37-snsf) the point in column 'location_point' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.
Indicates whether arrestee was an adult or juvenile at the time of arrest
Latitude and longitude of arrest location
Colorado Revised Statute or City of Colorado Springs Ordinance
Date and time of arrest
Uniform Crime Reporting Offense Code
National Crime Information Center Offense Code
Ethnicity of arrestee
Zip code in which arrest occurred

resource.name: Ticket And Citation Data with Demographics
resource.description: This is a data set containing tickets issued with demographic information for the ticketed person. This data set can be used for aggregating tickets by date and/or demographics.
columns_description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Neighborhoods' (2q37-snsf) the point in column 'location_point' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.
Age at Ticket Issue Date

resource.name: Officer Involved Shootings
resource.description: This dataset represents the information the Colorado Springs Police Department (CSPD) was required to report to the State of Colorado Division of Criminal Justice after an officer involved shooting. It is important to note the State of Colorado developed the options for each data field; these multiple choice items were not created by CSPD. Data provided for people categorized as "suspects" in these incidents. CSPD has chosen at this time to continue to update this information even though CSPD no longer has the requirement to report this information in this way. The data collection and reporting was required for the time period 1/1/2010 to 6/30/2020.  Law enforcement agencies will have the responsibility to collect and report different use of force information effective 7/1/2023.
columns_name: Prior to Shooting Officer Conducted a Search
Officer Issued Verbal Warning Prior to Shooting
Type of Search Conducted (prior to shooting)
columns_description: Whether or not an officer conducted a search prior to the shooting
Whether the subject of the shooting was arrested or cited for a crime. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Whether the person has Hispanic ethnicity. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Race of the person shot/shot at. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Number assigned to each subject in an officer involved shooting to make it easier for consumers of the data to know whether there is more than one subject in a particular incident.
Gender of the person shot/shot at. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Whether the subject of the shooting was under the influence of drugs and/or alcohol. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Indicates whether or not the officer was able to give a verbal warning before shooting their firearm.
The type of search that was conducted by an officer prior to the shooting. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Whether the officer(s) in the shooting sustained any injuries or was killed. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Short incident narrative
Whether the subject of the shooting sustained any injuries or was killed. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Age of the person shot/shot at
Reason officers initially contacted the subject of the shooting. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Location of shooting
Date and time shooting occurred
Case number (may be CSPD's or the investigative agencies' number)
The number CSPD uses to count the number of officer involved shootings in the dataset. Each incident may have multiple involved officers or subjects.
If a search was conducted by an officer prior to the shooting, whether contraband was found in the search.
Weapon subject was armed with at the time of the shooting. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Whether the subject was armed with a weapon
Physical or mental disability of the person shot/shot at . Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Sexual orientation of the person shot/shot at. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
Reason officer(s) shot/shot at the subject. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
If a search was conducted by an officer prior to the shooting, and contraband was found, the type of contraband found. Options are determined by the State of Colorado.
The Colorado Revised Statute corresponding to the most serious charge

resource.name: Demographics of Sworn Officers
resource.description: This dataset includes the race/ethnicity and gender of all CSPD sworn officers (also known as "peace officers," or "police officers").
columns_description: Gender of the sworn officer
Position classification of the sworn officer, ranging from Recruit to Chief (may also be considered "rank" of employee)
Race/ethnicity of the sworn officer
Number of years employed by the City of Colorado Springs; less than 1 year will show as "0"
